content:
Successfully created Schillinger JUCE Plugin (VST3/AU) with 36 parameters organized by category:
- Song Definition (5): tempo, timeSignatureNumerator/Denominator, scale, rootNote
- Rhythm (9): resultantType, periodicityA/B/C, density, complexity, rhythmicDensity, syncopation
- Melody (5): melodyContour, intervalRange, stepLeaping, repetition, sequenceLength
- Harmony (5): harmonyType, harmonicRhythm, chordDensity, voiceLeading, tension
- Structure (4): sections, sectionLength, transitionType, development
- Orchestration (5): registerValue, texture, articulation, dynamics, timbre
- Generation (3): seed, trigger, lengthBars

Key implementation decisions:
- Plugin produces MIDI output (isMidiEffect=true, producesMidi=true)
- Uses JUCE 8 ParameterLayout with variadic template (pass params individually via std::move)
- ParameterBuilder static methods: createFloatParameter, createIntParameter, createChoiceParameter
- Parameters stored as atomic<float>* for thread-safe access
- Timer-based UI updates (30Hz) for status display
- JavaScriptCore wrapper placeholder for future SDK integration

Files created:
- juce_backend/plugins/SchillingerPlugin/SchillingerPluginProcessor.h (.cpp)
- juce_backend/plugins/SchillingerPlugin/SchillingerPluginEditor.h (.cpp)
- Updated juce_backend/plugins/CMakeLists.txt with Schillinger target

Build successful with only Font deprecation warnings (non-critical).
Next steps: Implement JavaScriptCore integration for actual Schillinger SDK calls.
